meanings.definition: To write or carve words or symbols onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: She was inscribing her name on the tree trunk with a sharp rock.
meanings.sent2: The artist was inscribing intricate patterns on the clay pottery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel inscribed its tiny paw prints on the freshly poured cement.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was inscribed in the hearts of all who knew her.
meanings.sent5: The memory of that day was inscribed in her mind forever.

meanings.definition: To mark or engrave something onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: He carefully inscribed his initials on the golden locket.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization inscribed their history on stone tablets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat inscribed its territory by scratching the furniture.
meanings.sent4: His dedication was inscribed in every stroke of the masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The love they shared was inscribed in the old oak tree they carved their initials on.

meanings.definition: To enter or record something in a book or document.
meanings.sent1: The librarian was inscribing the due date on the borrowed book.
meanings.sent2: She inscribed her thoughts in her journal every night before bed.
meanings.sent3: The detective inscribed the suspect's alibi in his notebook.
meanings.sent4: His legacy was inscribed in the annals of history.
meanings.sent5: The ancient wisdom was inscribed in the scrolls of the monastery.
